newsitem.title: GERMANY: Reuters German Advertising & Media Digest - May 21.
newsitem.headline: Reuters German Advertising & Media Digest - May 21.

text.p: REUTERS GERMAN ADVERTISING & MEDIA DIGEST
News from Reuters and the German press on Advertising, Marketing, Media, Brand-name Products and Consumer Trends
ADVERTISING & MEDIA:

FRANKFURT - Advertising agency Ketchum Advertising will become a part of TBWA advertising group, effective immediately, and have its name changed to Planet Communications. (Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung)
BONN - Deutsche Telekom AG plans to launch two cable channels as soon as possible, making room for TV programming, chief executive Ron Sommer says. (Reuter)

BONN - Media giant Bertelsmann is determined to invest in digital television, board member Michael Dornemann says. Bertelsmann could take its pay television station Premiere and position it in competition with digital channel DF1 to further develop digital TV in Germany, Dornemann says. (Reuter)
DUESSELDORF - The all-news station N-TV Nachrichten GmbH & Co KG plans to "break even" this year, new programming director Helmut Brandstaetter tells the newspaper Der Tagesspiegel.
(Handelsblatt)
BRAND-NAME PRODUCTS & MARKETS:
NUREMBERG - U.S. telecommunications equipment supplier Lucent Technologies Inc says it has won a $30 million contract to provide mobile phone base stations to Deutsche Telekom AG.
(Reuter)
HAMBURG - Car giant Volkswagen AG says it plans volume growth between eight and 10 percent for 1997 after an 11 percent rise in customer deliveries in the first four months of the year.
(Reuter)

HANOI - Germany's Brauhaase Holding (Pacific) Ltd and two local partners have been granted a licence to build a $120-million beer factory in central Vietnam, a Ministry of Planning and Investment official says. (Reuter)
PEOPLE NEWS:
FRANKFURT - Television marketing company Media Gruppe Muenchen (MGM) names Lars Beulke as its new press department director.
(Reuter)
WALLDORF - Marc Pasture will join the managing board of LTU-Touristik airlines in June and take charge of marketing and distribution. (Kress)
FRANKFURT - Public station ARD has named Alber Schaefer children's programming director. (Frankfurter Rundschau)
